most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Startup and Login Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing crashes or getting stuck during startup or login after updating to Pieces OS 11.3.0.  Issues include database corruption, plugin integration problems, and authentication failures. Proposed solutions involve checking for existing issues, scheduling support calls, restarting the authentication flow, and potentially deleting and recreating the local database.

related_issues.title: Application Crash on Startup
related_issues.text:
Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User `moazzem-pixel` is experiencing crashes in the Pieces app after updating to version 10.9.6 on macOS 12.3 with MacBook Air (2022), M2. 
* Plugins A, B, and C are installed.
* Crash logs and error messages are attached to the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces app crashes upon launch.
* The issue appears similar to another reported issue (#686).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark, a Pieces team member, suggests checking if the reported issue is the same as the issue in #686.
* If not, scheduling a support call via the provided calendar link is recommended.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user needs to confirm if it is the same issue and proceed with either checking the other issue or scheduling a support call.
* The conversation is ongoing and the final outcome is not yet confirmed.

## Summary of GitHub Issue #686

**Key points raised:**
* User antoine79 is experiencing an issue with the initial bootup of their Pieces database.
* Mark from Pieces support has identified a potential issue and offered assistance.
* Antoine is a new user and open to deleting the existing database.

**Problems identified:**
* The Pieces database is not booting up properly.
* The cause of the issue is unclear.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
* Mark suggested scheduling a time to debug the issue in real-time.
* Antoine expressed their willingness to delete the database and start fresh.
* Mark provided the location of the database on Windows and macOS.

**Current status/outcome:**
* The issue is still being investigated internally by Pieces support.
* A potential fix may be available.
* Antoine has not yet scheduled a time to debug the issue or deleted the database.

**Additional notes:**
* The conversation suggests that the issue may be related to a recent bug with Pieces.
* Pieces support is actively working on a solution and is in contact with Antoine to resolve the issue.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Login issues after Pieces OS update

**Key points raised:**

* Users are unable to link their Google accounts after updating to Pieces OS version 11.3.0 on Windows 11.
* The login process on https://authentication.pieces.services/ hangs indefinitely after logging in with Google or Github.
* This issue appears to be related to the new authentication flow introduced in the recent update.

**Problems identified:**

* The login page at https://authentication.pieces.services/ gets stuck in an infinite loading state.
* This issue prevents users from linking their Google accounts and accessing their data and services.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark, a Pieces support representative, suggests attempting to log in through the Pieces toolbar or by scheduling time on their calendar.
* They also recommend restarting the authentication flow and double-checking all the authentication pipelines.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Mark is investigating the issue and has requested a screen recording from the user to further diagnose the problem.

**Additional notes:**

* This issue appears to be specific to the combination of Windows 11 and Pieces OS version 11.3.0.
* Users are encouraged to reach out to Pieces support for further assistance if the proposed solutions don't work.

recommendations: "Investigate and resolve the root cause of database corruption issues affecting Pieces OS 11.3.0, as indicated by the high frequency of related tickets (686, 687, 685)."

"Address the authentication issues users are facing with the new authentication flow introduced in Pieces OS 11.3.0, specifically the infinite loading problem on https://authentication.pieces.services/ (ticket 685)."

"Improve communication and guidance around Pieces OS updates, particularly regarding potential logout consequences and troubleshooting steps for login issues. This could involve clearer release notes or in-app notifications."
